title: Ekenäs IF
text:
Ekenäs Idrottsförening (abbreviated EIF or Ekenäs IF) is a sports club from <a href="Eken%C3%A4s%20%28Finland%29">Ekenäs</a>, <a href="Raseborg">Raseborg</a> in <a href="Finland">Finland</a>. EIF was formed in 1905 and they are one of the oldest clubs in the south-west of Finland. The men's <a href="association%20football">football</a> first team currently plays in the <a href="Ykk%C3%B6nen">Ykkönen</a> (First Division). Their home ground is at the Ekenäs Centrumplan in Ekenäs. The Chairman of EIF is Peter Haglund.
The club currently has sections covering football, <a href="Team%20handball">handball</a>, <a href="floorball">floorball</a> and <a href="disc%20golf">disc golf</a>. EIF's <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> section set up Karis IK and from 1 January 2009, simultaneously with a municipal merger, transferred its activities to the new IF Raseborg club.
History.
Ekenäs Idrottsförening has a long football history which reached its pinnacle with one season in the highest division, the Mestaruussarja (Championship), back in 1933. They have also had 8 seasons in the Suomisarjaa (Finland League) which at that time was the second tier of <a href="Finnish%20football%20league%20system">Finnish football</a> in 1938–39 and 1946/47–51.
EIF have had five periods covering 26 seasons in the <a href="Kakkonen">Kakkonen</a> (Second Division), the third tier of <a href="Finnish%20football%20league%20system">Finnish football</a> from 1975 to 1976, 1981–88, 1991–92, 1994–98 and 2002 to the current day.
EIF has a thriving junior section with a large number of teams.
A new highest ever attendance for an EIF match was made in 2013 when 2,014 people attended the home game with <a href="FC%20Jazz">FC Jazz</a>. The old record was from 1975 when 1,625 people attended the home game with HAIK.
EIF made history in March 2018 by qualifying for the Semi-final of the Finnish Cup for the first time, beating <a href="FC%20Haka">FC Haka</a> 2-1 at home.
Club structure.
EIF currently has 2 men's team, 1 ladies teams, 12 boys teams and 4 girls team.
Other facts.
EIF Akademi are participating in Section 1 (Lohko 1) of the <a href="Kolmonen%23Section%201%202">Kolmonen</a> (Third Division) administered by the Uusimaa SPL. In 2009 the team finished in top position in their <a href="Nelonen%202011%20League%20Tables%23Section%201%202">Nelonen</a> (Fourth Division) section and were promoted to the Kolmonen.
EIF Ladies Team are competing in the Kolmonen (Third Division) administered by the <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Finland">Football Association of Finland</a> " (Suomen Palloliitto) ". In 2017 the team finished in top position in their Nelonen (Fourth Division) section and were promoted to the Kolmonen.
First team.
"As of 2 July 2021."
